CTMC 47101689 019789 1/13/1990 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary DIS Report Status : Discharge Date : 01/21/1990 HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 57-year-old man who had a myocardial infarction in 1973 and a CVA in 1972 and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease who has been experiencing substernal chest pain with dyspnea on exertion since 09/89 . The patient had a cardiac catheterization prior to admission which showed 80% stenosis of the LAD and 80% stenosis of the RCA . He was admitted for elective coronary artery bypass graft . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Seizure disorder . CVA . ALLERGIES : MEDICATIONS : On admission revealed a 57-year-old white man in no acute distress . Temperature was 98 . Heart rate was 87 . Blood pressure was 130/60 . Neck was without jugular venous distention or carotid bruits . Lungs were clear to auscultation bilaterally . Pulses were 2+ bilaterally . Neurological exam revealed the patient to be alert and oriented times three . He did have venous stasis changes anteriorly on the right lower extremity . He had varicose veins on the right leg as well . On admission included normal electrolytes . BUN 14 . Hematocrit was 42.4 . Chest x-ray was clear . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was taken to the Operating Room on 1/13/90 . He underwent coronary artery bypass graft times three . He had a left internal mammory artery graft to the LAD and saphenous vein grafts to OM1 and PDA . Postoperatively , the patient did well and was extubated on postoperative day number one . On postoperative day number two , however , the patient had a cardiac arrest after an episode of rapid ventricular tachycardia and ventricular fibrillation . The patient was returned to normal sinus rhythm with a good blood pressure after cardioversion with 300 millivolts . It was not clear on what the precipitating factor was for this event . His oxygen saturation was 93% and p02 was 62 . The patient was stabilized in the Intensive Care Unit and was returned to the Step-Down Unit on postoperative day number three . He was ambulating well . His sternum was healing well and was stable . He was eating a regular diet . He had all his wires and staples removed on postoperative day number six . He was in sinus rhythm . He had a Holter monitor which showed no evidence of malignant rhythms prior to discharge . The patient was discharged to home on 1/21/90 . DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS : DISPOSITION : On discharge included Percocet , one to two po q three to four hours p.r.n. ; ASA , 225 mg po q day ; captopril , 18.75 mg po t.i.d. ; Dilantin , 100 mg po t.i.d. ; Pepcid , 20 mg po b.i.d. ; Vanceril inhaler , two puffs q four hours ; digoxin , 0.25 mg po q day . The patient will follow-up with Dr. Number in six weeks and with the patient 's own cardiologist in one week . The patient was discharged in stable condition .
